data.title: Things that remain to be seen ....
data.meta_description:
Ever heard of John Ballard?
If we count a lyricists, indeed it wasn't 100% non-Swedish entry.

Ever heard of John Ballard?

If we count a lyricists, indeed it wasn't 100% non-Swedish entry.

Joined

#22

The country that reaches the 6th position in this year's contest having a good position the following year maybe? (This year is already out because Ukraine is not in the contest, I mean this year's 6th)

The last one that made it was Spain in 2001, being 7th in 2002. Since then, the best position after being 6th is Bosnia, being 18th in 2012

PD: Belarus qualifying in a non-Scandinavian country

:O I didn't notice it before!!!

Belarus has only qualified when ESC is hosted in Scandinavian countries

2007 - Finland

2010 - Norway

2013 - Sweden

2014 - Denmark

We still wait to see France getting more than 150 points (max. 146 in 1991, and 107 in 2009 through the "modern era").

We also still wait to see Czech Republic getting more than 10 points in a semifinal (max. 9 in 2008, with Tereza Kerndlova).

#34

200- points and winning

That happened up until 1993. Ireland in 1994 was, to the best of my knowledge, the first time a country had ever got more than 200 points. I take it you now mean a country winning with fewer than 200 points when 39 countries will be voting (and hence a country can receive points from up to 38 other countries).
